tweet_text.117129: .@StevenGAdvocate Ebola is a rare and deadly disease caused by infection with one of the Ebola virus strains CDCchat
tweet_text.116986: .@MensHlthNetwork The current ebola outbreak is unprecedented in scale and spread. Past ebola outbreaks were very different. cdcchat
tweet_text.117020: .@bichnguyen0123 Patient was not infected with ebola in Dallas. He was exposed to a sick Ebola patient in Liberia prior to travel. cdcchat
tweet_text.117221: More ElbowOutEbola efforts. SierraLeone suspends female genital mutilation over Ebola. @Sianaarrgh protectwomen
tweet_text.116998: .@Danm414 - The strain in Dallas is the Ebola Zaire virus - consistent with the epidemic strain in West Africa. CDCchat
tweet_text.116985: .@atwalsukhreet To prevent ebola spread to other regions we must control the outbreak at its source in West Africa. cdcchat
tweet_text.116999: .@lsinco Need to stop epidemic in West Africa. More Ebola treatment units there are critical to contain spread
tweet_text.117168: CDC’s surge response means we are taking no chances leaving no stone unturned until 100% sure Ebola virus contained. CDCchat
tweet_text.117109: .@JensEmjens Yes the Ebola virus is present in sweat. CDCChat

tweet_text.117143: Ebola Facts: A person infected with Ebola virus is not contagious until symptoms appear. http://t.co/51O4bHlYTU
tweet_text.117102: .@nursefriendly Ebola only transmitted thru contact w/ body fluids from an infected person; a cough is unlikely to spread Ebola CDCChat
tweet_text.117023: .@set1958 - The patient did not have symptoms or exposure history consistent with Ebola. CDCchat

tweet_text.117195: IDC report claims that cuts to health aid compromised fight against Ebola in Liberia & SierraLeone. Sustained health spending is crucial

tweet_text.117137: Welcome to today’s CDCchat on Ebola. Thanks for joining us! We know you have many questions about Ebola & the 1st confirmed US case.

tweet_text.117009: .@tkyletucker Viruses do mutate but Ebola is very slow at mutation so unlikely. Best to stop epidemic quickly. CDCchat
